{include "default_salutation"} –

As the policing presence in Black and Brown communities has expanded, so have police budgets – with state and local governments across the country allocating over $115 billion a year to law enforcement.

There is a fundamental truth that we must confront: Black people continue to be murdered and brutalized by police with near impunity. More of the same won't fix this problem.

Last week, IMPD proposed their 2021 budget to the Indianapolis City-County Council Public Safety and Criminal Justice committee. In the committee hearing, IMPD outlined an overall $7 million increase in its 2021 budget, in which 82 percent will be used for officer salaries and benefits, with their focus on the recruitment of more officers.

Our message is clear: We must stop allocating funds for more officers and instead invest in health care, education, and community-run violence prevention programs. We must divest from police and reinvest in communities.

Make your voice heard before the full council votes on IMPD's budget.
